intro: Pepo aurantius, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers that open in the morning. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, though they may change color slightly as they ripen. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and thrives in warm, humid climates. The leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
